feed.title: Google Cloud: Buildpacks
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Buildpacks

entry.content: Cloud Run and Cloud Run functions source deployments support the pyproject.toml file for managing dependencies. This feature is in General Availability for all supported Python versions. For more information, see Deploy Python applications with a pyproject.toml file.
entry.summary: Cloud Run and Cloud Run functions now support the `pyproject.toml` file for managing Python dependencies. This feature is generally available for all supported Python versions, simplifying dependency management for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run supports pyproject.toml for Python deployments

entry.content: The Python buildpack supports default entrypoint detection for the Agent Development Kit (ADK) framework (Preview). For more information, see Build a Python application.
entry.summary: The Python buildpack now automatically detects the default entrypoint for the Agent Development Kit framework. This simplifies deployment of Python applications using ADK. Learn more about building Python applications with this new feature.
entry.title: Feature: Python ADK Entrypoint Detection

entry.content: Cloud Run and Cloud Run functions source deployments support pyproject.toml file for managing dependencies. This feature is in General Availability for Python version 3.13 and later, and is in Preview for Python version 3.12 and earlier. For more information, see Deploy Python applications with a pyproject.toml file.
entry.summary: Cloud Run and Cloud Run functions now support `pyproject.toml` for managing Python dependencies. This feature is generally available for Python 3.13+ and in preview for older versions.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run Supports Pyproject.toml

entry.content: Support for osonly24 runtime is in Preview. The OS only runtime lets you deploy Go applications from source, and binaries such as Dart and Go. For more information, see Configure the OS only runtime.
entry.summary: You can now deploy Go applications and binaries like Dart and Go from source using the OS only runtime, which is currently in preview. This feature allows for greater flexibility in how you deploy your applications. For further details, refer to the OS only runtime configuration documentation.
entry.title: Feature: OS only runtime support now in preview

entry.content:
Cloud Run and Cloud Run functions source deployments support pyproject.toml file for managing dependencies. If you use a pyproject.toml file, source deployments use one of the following to find and install dependencies:

  • pip
  • uv
  • poetry

For more information, see Deploy Python applications with a pyproject.toml file (Preview).
entry.summary: Cloud Run and Cloud Run Functions now support pyproject.toml for managing Python dependencies using pip, uv, or poetry during source deployments.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run Python Dependency Management Update

entry.content: Ubuntu 24 builder with the google-24 stack is available for Google Cloud's Buildpacks. For more information, see Builders and Use a specific builder.
entry.summary: The Ubuntu 24 builder with the google-24 stack is now available for Google Cloud's Buildpacks. This feature allows you to use the latest Ubuntu version for your builds. For more details, refer to the documentation on builders and using specific builders.
entry.title: Feature: Ubuntu 24 builder now available

entry.content:
The Python buildpack supports Cloud Run source deployments for modern web frameworks such as FastAPI, Gradio, and Streamlit.

For Python version 3.13 and later, the Python buildpack sets the default entrypoint for Cloud Run source deployments based on the web server or framework configuration in your requirements.txt file. For more information, see Build a Python application.
entry.summary: New buildpack for Python apps on Cloud Run.
entry.title: Feature: Python buildpack update
